description: The tool below enables you to explore the Flight Data APIs by building queries and viewing live data
steps: Copy the 'Key' which will be used as your 'userKey' on RapidAPI

blocks.name: getFlightsByAirline
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of flight summaries for a given airline using an extended version of FIXM 3.0, including scheduled and airborne flights.

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: airlinePrefix
args.info: The ICAO prefix for an airline e.g. BAW (Case sensitive)

args.name: status
args.info: Flight Status (airborne, cancelled, completed, filed or scheduled)

blocks.name: getFlightsByAerodrome
blocks.description: Retrieves summary information for flights arriving or that are scheduled to arrive at the given aerodrome using an extended version of FIXM 3.0, including scheduled and airborne flights.

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: aerodromeICAO
args.info: The ICAO code for an aerodrome to see arrivals for e.g. EGLL (Case sensitive)

args.name: status
args.info: Flight Status (airborne, cancelled, completed, filed or scheduled)

blocks.name: getDeparturesByAerodrome
blocks.description: Retrieves summary information for flights departing or that are scheduled to depart from the given aerodrome using an extended version of FIXM 3.0, including scheduled and airborne flights. Summary information includes:

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: aerodromeICAO
args.info: The ICAO code for an aerodrome to see arrivals for e.g. EGLL (Case sensitive)

args.name: status
args.info: Flight Status (airborne, cancelled, completed, filed or scheduled)

blocks.name: getFlightDataFirLoad
blocks.description: Retrieves flights within a given FIR. This GeoJSON API, available via RESTful or streaming interfaces, contains the following European flight data: Estimated FIR entry time (flights scheduled to enter the chosen FIR) Actual FIR entry timestamp (airborne flights currently in the FIR / flights that have already passed through the FIR)and Positional reports (for airborne flights)

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: icaoPrefix
args.info: First letter of the ICAO designator e.g. E (Case sensitive)

args.name: firIcao
args.info: ICAO code of the FIR e.g. EGTT (Case sensitive)

args.name: status
args.info: Flight Status (airborne, cancelled, completed, filed or scheduled)

blocks.name: getFlightDetailByGUFI
blocks.description: Retrieves the most complete picture of a single flight using an extended version of FIXM 3.0. Completed flights will remain accessible in the API for 3 hours after the flight has landed.

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: gufi
args.info: GUFI of the flight to look up e.g. `761b728a-9a50-4222-8325-8be4a1574241`

blocks.name: getFlightDelayByGUFI
blocks.description: Retrieves the delay for a single flight. Available in both JSON and XML. Completed flights will remain accessible in the API for 6 hours after the flight has landed. Note that the example GUFI below will not work; you will need a current one from one of the other API calls (e.g. Flights by Airline).

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: gufi
args.info: GUFI of the flight to look up e.g. `761b728a-9a50-4222-8325-8be4a1574241`

blocks.name: getFlightsByTile
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of flight summaries for a given tile using an extended version of FIXM 3.0. For more information on tiling see below. The API only returns airborne flights.

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: xCoordinate
args.info: The x coordinate in the Mercator projection e.g. 3 (Accepts values 0 - 7)

args.name: yCoordinate
args.info: The y coordinate in the Mercator projection e.g. 2 (Accepts values 0 - 7)

blocks.name: flightsByAerodromePair
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of flight summaries between a pair of aerodromes using an extended version of FIXM 3.0, including scheduled and airborne flights.

args.name: userKey
args.info: User Key Authentication Parameter

args.name: originIcao
args.info: The ICAO code for an aerodrome of origin e.g. EGLL (Case sensitive)

args.name: destinationIcao
args.info: The ICAO code for an aerodrome destination e.g. KJFK (Case sensitive)
